item.title: Contamination of my property, 12th June
item.description:
As you can read from a previous report as ent in May, this is continuing to happen. The report came back as fixed. This is clearly not the case. I have spoken to the operators who confirm they have received no instructions regarding this. Is this going to continue throughout the summer , wasting me and the council time.regards

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Milk Street, Sundridge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uneven ground, 12th June
item.description:
The tarmac is uneven in the park and been like this for some time. The part that worries me the most is the part which is lifted in front of the slide. My son has tripped over it once but I am literally behind his every move due to the park being unsafe. Lucky I caught him before his neck hit the slide. It’s actually very dangerous and should be looked into. The plants seem to get more attention from governors and council staff. It looks neglected. Mt daughter started primary school in September 2023 - the tarmac has been the same since before then.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Drury Lane, Holborn, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly-tipped rubbish now spilling onto road, 12th June
item.description:
Fly-tipped rubbish now spilling onto road, saw children trying to set fire to it last Saturday. Please just clear it up Bromley, you will have to soon as it's only going to get worse and impede road users. So let's just be proactive and clear it up before it gets any worse?

item.title: Flytipping of rubbish on the pavement o/s 53 Nuxley Road, 12th June
item.description:
Flytipping of rubbish on the pavement o/s 53 Nuxley Road - there is a commercial bin that is sitting in the road and people are putting their rubbish in the bin and it is overflowing and now they are leaving rubbish around the bin on the pavement. The bin used to belong to the chicken shop that is no longer and now doesn't belong to anyone so this needs to be removed and then this should help the flytipping of rubbish. Can this be looked into and sorted out please
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 53, Nuxley Road, Lessness Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement Blocked constantly by cars, 12th June
item.description:
I am writing once again to express serious concern regarding the recurring obstruction of the pavement by vehicles pulling up at the MOT station on 117-119 Charlton Rd, London SE3 8TL This has become a persistent issue that poses a real danger to pedestrians, especially children, parents with prams, and disabled individuals using scooters or wheelchairs. On many occasions, I have witnessed people being forced to walk into traffic because cars are completely blocking the pavement. This is not only highly unsafe but also a clear violation of pedestrian rights. Additionally, there is frequently oil spilled on the pavement in front of the shop, creating both an environmental concern and a slip hazard. To address this issue, I strongly urge the council to implement road markings—specifically a hatched area—in front of the MOT station to prevent vehicles from stopping there altogether. This simple measure would greatly improve safety and accessibility for all road users. I have reported this problem previously, but it appears that no action has been taken. I hope this time it will be treated with the urgency and seriousness it deserves.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wyndcliff Road, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet
